snippet: Northern Mali has become a magnet for Islamic extremists who have imposed a strict form of justice that is prompting tens of thousands of people to flee what some are likening to an African Afghanistan.
abstract: Northern Mali has become a magnet for Islamic extremists who have imposed a strict form of justice that is prompting tens of thousands of people to flee; refugees who have fled to Mauritania describe witnessing harsh forms of punishment administered by Islamists hailing from a wide variety of countries.

byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Northern Mali has become a magnet for Islamic extremists who have imposed a strict form of justice that is prompting tens of thousands of people to flee what some are likening to an African Afghanistan.
